results.title: Le Choix des Armes
results.brief_description: The high walls of a prison. Two running shadows in the night, a parked Volvo car whose engine is running. Suddenly, the shrieking sound of an alarm hooter. Both men get hastily inside the car which starts immediately. A well directed drama about a retired gangster (Yves Montand) forced into an antagonistic relationship with a young punk. (Gerard Depardieu).

results.title: Le Chevalier de Pardaillan
results.creator_credit: Bernard Borderie, Andre Haguet and Andre Legrand
results.brief_description:
In 1588, the Duke de Guise and princess Fausta are vying for the crown. Violetta, a young gypsy who has caught the duke’s eyes, is the object of a merciless competition between would-be lovers. When the duke discovers Violetta is of noble origins, he has her kidnapped in order to help in his attempt to overthrow the king. Pardaillan must then intervene to save the king and the damsel in distress.

Credits: Producers, Andre Legrand, Andre Haguet ; director, Bernard Borderie ; writers, Henri Haguet, Bernard Borderie ; photography, Henri Persin ; music, Paul Misraki ; costumes, Rosine Delamare.
Cast: Gerard Barray, Jean Topart, Gianna-Maria Canale, Michele Grellier, Guy Delorme.

results.title: Le Chevalier de Maison Rouge = the Cavalier Maison Rouge
results.brief_description:
Paris, 1793. Maurice Lindey, a young and fervent revolutionary rescues a mysterious woman from the clutches of the citizen’s army. That same night, Maison Rouge makes an attempts to have the Queen and the royal family escape from the Prison du Temple and a handsome reward is offered for his capture. Lindey follows the musterious woman, only to learn that her name is Genvieve Dixmer and that she is married to the owner of a tannery. Maurice is ivited to the house and recived as a firend. He is far too in love to realise that the house is full of conspirators. He even goes as far as introducing Genevieve to the Queen. When she is caught with a message for the Queen, again, Maurice covers for Genevieve and falls under the suspicion of his revolutionary friends.

Credits: Producer, Robert Paiilardon ; director, Claude Barma ; writers, Jacques Armand, Claude Barma ; photography, Jacques Lemare ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Annie Ducaux, Jean Desailly, Francois Chaumette, Julien Berthau, Dominique Paturel, Anne Doat, Michel Leroyer.

results.title: Le Cheval D'orgueil = the Horse of Pride
results.creator_credit: Claude Chabrol and Georges de Beauregard
results.brief_description:
Between 1908 and 1918, Pierre-Jakez Helias spent his childhood in Bigouden country (French Brittany). The First World War brings about many changes in the traditional life of a village where pride is more abundant than riches. The central theme of the film is the perpetuation of Brittany’s culture (and language) via oral, rather than written tradition.

Credits: Producer, Georges de Beauregard ; director, Claude Chabrol ; writer, Daniel Boulanger ; photography, Jean Rabier ; music, Pierre Jansen ; art direction, Hilton McConnico.
Cast: Jacques Dufilho, Bernadette Le Sache, Francois Cluzet, Dominique Lavanant, Michel Blanc, Paul Le Person, Michel Robin, Georges Wilson [narration only].

results.title: Le Chaud Lapin = the Hot Rabbit
results.brief_description:
William is a relentless womaniser who has to leave his many conquests behind to go and spend the summer vacation in a country house with relatives of one of his friends. Stranded in the isolated rural cottage, he attempts to bed every female member of the clan. Unsuccessful and extremely frustrated, he is determined to have some fun on his vacation and abandons the whole group in pursuit of a trio of hippyish females who flirted with him earlier.

Credits: Director, Pascal Thomas ; writers, Jacques Lourcelles, Pascal Thomas, Hubert Watrinet ; photography, Colin Mounier ; music, Vladimir Cosma.
Cast: Bernard Menez, Daniel Ceccaldi, Brigitte Gruel.

results.title: Le Chat et la Souris = the Cat and the Mouse
results.brief_description:
Richard, a philandering financier, is found murdered in his luxurious riverside mansion. Precious paintings have also disappeared. Inspector Lechat is put in charge of the investigation and immediately suspects Richard’s wife of eliminating her husband. As Lechat investigates her alibi, he becomes increasingly attracted to ‘the mouse’.

Credits: Director, Claude Lelouch ; writer, Claude Lelouch ; photography, Jean Collomb ; music, Francis Lai.
Cast: Serge Reggiani, Philippe Leotard, Michele Morgan, Valerie Lagrange, Jean-Pierre Aumont.

results.title: Le Charme Discret de la Bourgeoisie = the discreet charm of the bourgeoisie
results.brief_description:
Three ‘bourgeois’ who have built their fortune on drug trafficking attempt to get together to celebrate a successful transaction, but only there are complications waiting at every turn. Bunuel applies his surrealist touch to a mundane event: a dinner party that may never come to pass. The initial problem seems to be a simple scheduling mistake, but the obstacles become more and more bizarre. At one point, the guests are interrupted at the table by an army on manoeuvres. Awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Film 1972

Credits: Producer, Serge Silberman ; director, Luis Bunuel ; writer, Luis Bunuel, Jean-Claude Carriere ; photography, Edmond Richard.
Cast: Fernando Rey, Paul Frankeur, Delphine Seyrig, Bulle Ogier, Jean-Pierre Cassel, Stephane Audran, Claude Pieplu, Michel Piccoli, Muni, Pierre Maguelon, Francois Maistre.

results.title: Le Chapeau de L'empereur = the Emperor's Hat
results.brief_description:
Police chief Henry is working hard to have Vidocq promoted to head of Police Services. A few days before an official visit by Napoleon, the Police Museum is burgled and the Emperor’s hat is stolen. Flambard is designated to take the blame and resign, unless he can recover the precious hat before the visit. To do so, Flambart has no choice but to ask help from his old enemy, Vidocq.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Claude Loursais ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Louis Arbessier, Gabriel Gabin, Robert Bazil, William Sabatier.

results.title: Le Chant du Monde
results.creator_credit: Marcel Camus, Michel Choquet, Claire Duval, Liber Films, Films Marceau and Orphee Productions
results.brief_description: In Haute-Provence, two rival clans are in constant battle against one another. In the midst of this conflict, a passionate love affair unfolds. Stars Catherine Deneuve, Hardy Kruger, Charles Vanel. Based on a novel by Jean Giono.
